featured_priority.title: Pushing the Boundaries of Video Innovation Through the Power of Collaboration
featured_priority.summary: At Harmonic, we believe that innovation in video delivery starts with deep collaboration.  Our work with NVIDIA over the years has been instrumental in unlocking the full potential of NVENC and NVDEC to enable advanced capabilities like AI-driven noise reduction, upscaling and frame rate doubling. These enhancements deliver stunning video quality for our customers across multiple codecs, including AVC, HEVC, AVI, and even for MV-HEVC for spatial videos.  The video quality enhancements are further optimized by Harmonic’s EyeQ™ technology that leverages-trained Convolutional Neural Network models for rate control and mode decisions.

items.title: Netflix Removes Support for Casting From Most Devices
items.summary: Netflix just made its service less user-friendly when traveling. Netflix announced it no longer supports casting shows from mobile devices to most TVs and streaming devices. Casting will now only work on older Chromecast models without remotes and TVs with Google Cast, regardless of whether you’re on an ad-supported or ad-free Netflix plan.

items.title: Accelerating creative workflows with the AWS Creative Innovation Hub in London
items.summary: A phrase often heard in the media industry is: We’ve always done it this way. As an industry, we need fresh ideas and new approaches to keep pace with with rapid technological change and evolving audience demand for content at unprecedented scale and speed. As Amazon Web Services (AWS) specialists working with creative businesses, we […].

items.title: Introducing the expanded AWS Well-Architected Video Streaming Advertising Lens
items.summary: At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are delighted to introduce the next revision to the AWS Well-Architected Video Streaming Advertising (VSA) Lens. The expanded VSA Lens consists of a Lens whitepaper and custom lens, which will become available in the public AWS Well-Architected custom lens GitHub repository. The April 25, 2025 launch of the original […].

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery reinvents linear television advertising with AWS
items.summary: When brands run ads during linear free-to-air (FTA) broadcasts, they can loosely target messages based on a program’s viewer demographics, but they’re generally casting a wide net. There’s limited visibility into whether they’re reaching the intended audience and if the message engages the viewer. Committed to shaking up the status quo, the Warner Bros.

items.title: October + November Product Releases: Closing Out the Fall of Features
items.summary: Revisit the biggest reveals from MAX 2025 and explore the new releases that you haven’t seen yet. With Adobe MAX 2025 behind us, the Fall of Features is officially wrapped—but...

items.title: The Ultimate Guide to the New Frame.io Search Experience
items.summary: The most significant evolution in Frame.io search—ever. If you’ve worked in media for any length of time, you know that finding can be almost as challenging as creating. Entire productions...

items.title: Holstein Kiel transforms scouting with OpenAI models on Amazon Bedrock
items.summary: This blog post was co-authored by Markus Brunnschneider, Head of Game and Tactical Analysis, Squad Planning and Scouting, International Football Institute. Traditional football clubs generate vast amounts of player data but often struggle to transform it into competitive advantages. Holstein Kiel solved this challenge by implementing an AI-powered scouting platform using OpenAI models on Amazon […].

items.title: Agentic AI headlines AWS re:Invent 2025 across Media and Entertainment
items.summary: Agentic AI is rapidly reshaping workloads across industries and is taking center stage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) re:Invent conference this year. In media and entertainment (M&E), AI is accelerating workflows, unlocking new capabilities, and transforming how content is created, captured, and delivered. In advertising, AI is empowering companies and brands to engage audiences and […].

items.title: Pushing the Boundaries of Video Innovation Through the Power of Collaboration
items.summary: At Harmonic, we believe that innovation in video delivery starts with deep collaboration.  Our work with NVIDIA over the years has been instrumental in unlocking the full potential of NVENC and NVDEC to enable advanced capabilities like AI-driven noise reduction, upscaling and frame rate doubling. These enhancements deliver stunning video quality for our customers across multiple codecs, including AVC, HEVC, AVI, and even for MV-HEVC for spatial videos.  The video quality enhancements are further optimized by Harmonic’s EyeQ™ technology that leverages-trained Convolutional Neural Network models for rate control and mode decisions.

items.title: Brownfield MDU Broadband: Unlocking Revenue with Existing Infrastructure
items.summary: From Burden to Breakthrough Brownfield multi-dwelling unit ( MDUs) are often viewed as complex and costly to upgrade. In reality, many properties already have existing coax or fiber that can be leveraged, and residents in those buildings are demanding more bandwidth. With the right approach and technology, these legacy buildings can be transformed from perceived burdens into strategic assets that support new revenue and sustainable growth.

items.title: The Economics of Hybrid Streaming Architectures
items.summary: Streaming viewership continues to grow — not only in the U.S. as shown by Nielsen’s The Gauge, but also globally. In Europe, TF1 and RTL mention in their Q1 2025 financial reports that their respective streaming platforms increased digital ad revenue by approximately 30% year-over-year.

items.title: The Everything Era: What NAB 2025 Really Told Us About Streaming’s Future
items.summary: This year’s NAB wasn’t defined by spectacle. It was defined by perspective. Yes, there was plenty of AI on display.

items.title: Unified DOCSIS 4.0
items.summary: Improving quality of experience for each subscriber is the next frontier in subscriber satisfaction and retention. Unified DOCSIS 4.0 takes DOCSIS 4.0 to a new level, offering a revolutionary solution that empowers operators with access to both Full Duplex (FDX) and Frequency Division Duplex (FDD)  DOCSIS 4.0 technologies. With virtualized solutions, operators can leverage the valuable combination of edge compute infrastructure with cloud services to adapt and perform for best quality of experience.

items.title: OLT and ONT Interoperability: A New Path Forward
items.summary: The Evolution of Fiber Broadband Networks     As fixed-line fiber optic networks continue their rapid expansion, operators face a persistent challenge: achieving true interoperability between optical network terminals (ONTs) or optical network units (ONUs) and optical line terminals (OLTs). While passive optical network (PON) technologies have advanced significantly, the promise of seamless multi-vendor integration remains largely unfulfilled.   .

items.title: Harmonic Leads Broadband Industry Transformation
items.summary: The broadband industry is in a period of critical transformation driven by the rise of DOCSIS 4.0, deeper fiber deployments and the increasing demand for higher bandwidth. This has resulted in heightened economic and competitive pressures for broadband operators. Choosing the right technology partner with the necessary expertise, leadership and business stability will determine the success of their business evolution and longevity. .

items.title: How Cloud-Based Playout-to-Delivery Drives Cost Efficiency
items.summary: More and more broadcasters and content owners are moving their playout workflows to the public cloud. A recent survey of over 200 media and entertainment executives show that 30 percent of them have considered migrating to cloud playout for broadcast. The main reasons driving this decision include scalability, better end-user experience, the willingness to upgrade technology, shorter time to market of services and cost reduction.

items.title: Broadband Operators Pick up the Pace with vCMTS and DAA Adoption
items.summary: Adoption and deployment of DAA enabled with a virtualized broadband platform are accelerating, marking a significant shift in how operators evolve their networks. What factors are driving this transformation and why now? A combination of economic pressures, competitive threats, and technological necessity are driving operators to quickly adopt and deploy more effective solutions.

items.title: How Harmonic's Customer Migrated Seamlessly from Satellite to SRT Distribution
items.summary: In the evolving video distribution landscape, modernizing infrastructure is crucial for broadcast networks to meet the demands of high-quality, flexible content delivery. This blog explores how one tier-1 broadcaster successfully modernized its video distribution infrastructure with Harmonic's advanced solution.
